did.abstract: The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Foundation Records currently consists of published programs and digital video files for the annual Hall of Fame induction ceremonies from 1986 to 2013. Additional materials related to the history of the Foundation, the induction ceremonies, and related programming exist but are not described here nor are they available to the public at this time.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Foundation Records were received by the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and Museum, Inc., as gifts from the Foundation between 2009 and 2013.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: In 1983, a small group of music industry professionals led by Atlantic Records Founder and Chairman Ahmet Ertegun and including Rolling Stone magazine publisher Jann Wenner, attorneys Allen Grubman and Suzan Evans, manager Jon Landau, and record executives Seymour Stein and Bob Krasnow set out to establish an organization to “recognize the people who have created this music which has become the most popular music of our time.” Ertegun approached the heads of various record companies with his idea, spearheading the formation of the non-profit organization that would eventually become the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Foundation.

In 1986, the Foundation held the first annual Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Induction Ceremony at the Waldorf-Astoria Grand Ballroom in New York City. The same year, the Foundation selected Cleveland as the permanent home of the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and Museum, which opened in September 1995. In 2006, Joel Peresman, a music industry veteran and former chief of Concerts and Entertainment at Madison Square Garden, became President and CEO of the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Foundation. Under Peresman’s leadership, the Foundation announced the return of the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Induction Ceremonies to Cleveland in 2009 and every three years thereafter.

The Foundation also staged the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame 25th Anniversary concerts on October 29 and 30, 2009, at Madison Square Garden in New York City. These historic shows and their broadcast on HBO helped fund the first-ever endowment for the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and Museum in Cleveland.

In addition to these projects, the Foundation provided an $8 million gift in 2008 to the Museum’s Capital Campaign, which was used to build the Library and Archives in downtown Cleveland and funded the 2010-2011 redesign of the Museum interior. The Foundation also provides funding for Museum capital projects on an on-going basis and continues to be the largest single contributor to the Museum. Beyond funding, the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Foundation leverages its presence in one of the world’s major cultural and philanthropic centers to provide increased exposure for the Museum mission, connections to artists and philanthropists, and other partnerships to advance the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and Museum’s cultural preservation initiatives.

The Hall of Fame annually inducts a new class of individuals under one of four categories: Performer, Ahmet Ertegun Award, Early Influence, and Award for Musical Excellence. Artists become eligible for induction as a Performer 25 years after the release of their first record. Criteria include the influence and significance of the artists’ contributions to the development and perpetuation of rock and roll. The Foundation’s nominating committee selects nominees each year in the Performer category. Ballots are then sent to an international voting body of more than 600 artists, historians and members of the music industry. Those performers who receive the highest number of votes--and more than 50 percent of the vote--are inducted. The Foundation generally inducts five to seven performers each year.

The Ahmet Ertegun Award was introduced in 2011. Previously known as the Non-Performer category, the Award inducts songwriters, producers, disc jockeys, record executives, journalists and other industry professionals who have had a major influence on the development of rock and roll.

Early Influences include artists whose music predated rock and roll but had an impact on the evolution of rock and roll and inspired rock’s leading artists. A special selection committee elects the inductees in the Ahmet Ertegun Award and Early Influences categories.

The Award for Musical Excellence category was introduced in 2000. In 2011, the Sidemen category was folded into the Award for Musical Excellence. It honors those musicians, producers and others who have spent their careers out of the spotlight working with major artists on various parts of their recording and live careers. Though they often play a key role in the creation of memorable music, the public rarely knows them by name. A separate committee selects the inductees in this category.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Subgroup 1: Annual Induction Ceremonies consists of published programs and digital video files for the annual Hall of Fame induction ceremonies from 1986 to 2013.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Some of the materials in this subgroup are CLOSED, as they have not yet been processed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I: Programs contains a copy of the printed program published each year for the annual induction ceremony by the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Foundation. The programs include profiles of the year's Hall of Fame inductees and discuss the development of related music scenes and genres. Duplicate copies for the majority of the programs are available for perusal in both the Library and Archives Reading Rooms. Select the Event/Series facet "Annual induction ceremony (Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Foundation)" in the online catalog for a list of available programs and their location.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II: Digital Video includes a digital video file for each video tape that was created in the process of filming the annual induction ceremonies, spanning 1986 to 2013. These files in some cases include not only the edited master files but different camera angles filmed during the course of the ceremony. Please note that not all files are currently available in the online catalog and, those that are, are only available to view on site.
